newsitem.title: CHINA: PRESS DIGEST - Shanghai newspapers - April 17.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Shanghai newspapers - April 17.

text.p: Following is a summary of major political and business stories in local newspapers, prepared by Reuters in Shanghai. Reuters has not checked the stories and does not guarantee their accuracy.

- SHANGHAI SECURITIES NEWS - Zhou Zhengqing, chairman of the Securities Commission under the State Council, or cabinet, tells a seminar in Beijing that a key task for China's securities markets is to strengthen surpervision.
- China will issue 40 billion yuan worth in three-year treasury notes in May with an annual coupon of 9.18 percent, the third state debt issue this year.
- China has sold 54.7 billion yuan or 44.49 percent of the 123 billion yuan in treasury notes issued from March 1 to October 20 in 1997's second state debt issue.
- BUSINESS NEWS - The Chinese yuan is under pressure to rise further this year after three years of consecutive rises due to China's surging foreign exchange reserves and heavy foreign trade surplus.
- Foreign trade turnover of the Pudong development zone increased by a year-on-year 23.36 percent to $1.722 billion yuan in the first three months of 1997.
